titleStmt.title: By the King although the offences committed against the Queene our sister deceased, and the honour of her estate by the Earle of Tyrone, were such as al princes ought to be very sensible of ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: For readmitting the Earl of Tyrone to favor.
"Giuen at our Manour of Greenwich the eighth day of Iune, in the first yeere of our Reigne."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
